page.title: 14Nympsfield 800 Celebrations.
page.content: On{6th.July 1985}Nympsfield woke up as{Ambridge,}the Archers' home,to mark the{800th. anniversary}of the priest, {Adam the Clerk,}in Nympsfield.The aim was to raise funds to repair the church tower and the pinnacles.There was a TV.preview on 2nd July to attract visitors to the transformed village.The Bull,the Ambridge Stores, Grey Gables and Brookfield Farm were a few of the places.Four characters from the Archers spent the day in'Ambridge' and had tea at the Bull.Other forms of entertainment were Batricar races,the West Coast Cadets band,an Exhibition,a dog agility show, a Maypole Dance and many others.On the 7th.July there were floral displays in the churches and chapel.Nineteen gardens were open,some serving cream-teas.About{2,500 people {visited the village and Â£3,000}of Â£11,000}needed was raised.
